AllergyIntolerance.definition: Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this AllergyIntolerance by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

contains.name: clinicalStatus
contains.definition: The clinical status of the allergy or intolerance.

contains.name: verificationStatus
contains.definition: Assertion about certainty associated with the propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance (including pharmaceutical product).

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the reaction risk.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: Category of the identified substance.

contains.name: criticality
contains.definition: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of the reaction to the identified substance.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement).  This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk (e.g., "Latex"), an allergy or intolerance condition (e.g., "Latex allergy"), or a negated/excluded code for a specific substance or class (e.g., "No latex allergy") or a general or categorical negated statement (e.g.,  "No known allergy", "No known drug allergies").  Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.  If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.

contains.name: patient
contains.definition: The patient who has the allergy or intolerance.

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: The encounter when the allergy or intolerance was asserted.

contains.name: onsetDateTime
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

contains.name: onsetAge
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

contains.name: onsetPeriod
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

contains.name: onsetRange
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

contains.name: onsetString
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

contains.name: recordedDate
contains.definition: The recordedDate represents when this particular AllergyIntolerance record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

contains.name: recorder
contains.definition: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

contains.name: asserter
contains.definition: The source of the information about the allergy that is recorded.

contains.name: lastOccurrence
contains.definition: Represents the date and/or time of the last known occurrence of a reaction event.

contains.name: note
contains.definition: Additional narrative about the propensity for the Adverse Reaction, not captured in other fields.

contains.name: reaction
contains.definition: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified substance.

contains.name: substance
contains.definition: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.  If a receiving system is unable to confirm that AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance falls within the semantic scope of AllergyIntolerance.code, then the receiving system should ignore AllergyIntolerance.reaction.substance.

contains.name: manifestation
contains.definition: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event.

contains.name: description
contains.definition: Text description about the reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.

contains.name: onset
contains.definition: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the Reaction.

contains.name: severity
contains.definition: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

contains.name: exposureRoute
contains.definition: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.

contains.name: note
contains.definition: Additional text about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.

CarePlan.definition: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient, group or community for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this care plan by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

contains.name: instantiatesCanonical
contains.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

contains.name: instantiatesUri
contains.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

contains.name: basedOn
contains.definition: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

contains.name: replaces
contains.definition: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.

contains.name: partOf
contains.definition: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

contains.name: intent
contains.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the care plan and where the care plan fits into the workflow chain.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", "wellness plan", etc.

contains.name: title
contains.definition: Human-friendly name for the care plan.

contains.name: description
contains.definition: A description of the scope and nature of the plan.

contains.name: subject
contains.definition: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is described by the plan.

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: The Encounter during which this CarePlan was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

contains.name: created
contains.definition: Represents when this particular CarePlan record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

contains.name: author
contains.definition: When populated, the author is responsible for the care plan.  The care plan is attributed to the author.

contains.name: contributor
contains.definition: Identifies the individual(s) or organization who provided the contents of the care plan.

contains.name: careTeam
contains.definition: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.

contains.name: addresses
contains.definition: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.

contains.name: supportingInfo
contains.definition: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include comorbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.

contains.name: goal
contains.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.

contains.name: activity
contains.definition: Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan.  For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.

contains.name: outcomeCodeableConcept
contains.definition: Identifies the outcome at the point when the status of the activity is assessed.  For example, the outcome of an education activity could be patient understands (or not).

contains.name: outcomeReference
contains.definition: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity.  The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself.  The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a “request” resource).

contains.name: progress
contains.definition: Notes about the adherence/status/progress of the activity.

contains.name: reference
contains.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

contains.name: detail
contains.definition: A simple summary of a planned activity suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.

contains.name: kind
contains.definition: A description of the kind of resource the in-line definition of a care plan activity is representing.  The CarePlan.activity.detail is an in-line definition when a resource is not referenced using CarePlan.activity.reference.  For example, a MedicationRequest, a ServiceRequest, or a CommunicationRequest.

contains.name: instantiatesCanonical
contains.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.

contains.name: instantiatesUri
contains.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: Detailed description of the type of planned activity; e.g. what lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

contains.name: reasonCode
contains.definition: Provides the rationale that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan or the reason why the activity was prohibited.

contains.name: reasonReference
contains.definition: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

contains.name: goal
contains.definition: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.

contains.name: statusReason
contains.definition: Provides reason why the activity isn't yet started, is on hold, was cancelled, etc.

contains.name: doNotPerform
contains.definition: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan.  If false, or missing, indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.

contains.name: scheduledTiming
contains.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

contains.name: scheduledPeriod
contains.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

contains.name: scheduledString
contains.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

contains.name: location
contains.definition: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

contains.name: performer
contains.definition: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.

contains.name: productCodeableConcept
contains.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

contains.name: productReference
contains.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

contains.name: dailyAmount
contains.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day.

contains.name: quantity
contains.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied, administered or consumed by the subject.

contains.name: description
contains.definition: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities.  It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions.  Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc.

contains.name: note
contains.definition: General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.

Claim.definition: A provider issued list of professional services and products which have been provided, or are to be provided, to a patient which is sent to an insurer for reimbursement.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this claim.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: The status of the resource instance.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The category of claim, e.g. oral, pharmacy, vision, institutional, professional.

contains.name: subType
contains.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.

contains.name: use
contains.definition: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: to request adjudication of products and services previously rendered; or requesting authorization and adjudication for provision in the future; or requesting the non-binding adjudication of the listed products and services which could be provided in the future.

contains.name: patient
contains.definition: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual or forecast reimbursement is sought.

contains.name: billablePeriod
contains.definition: The period for which charges are being submitted.

contains.name: created
contains.definition: The date this resource was created.

contains.name: enterer
contains.definition: Individual who created the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

contains.name: insurer
contains.definition: The Insurer who is target of the request.

contains.name: provider
contains.definition: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

contains.name: priority
contains.definition: The provider-required urgency of processing the request. Typical values include: stat, routine deferred.

contains.name: fundsReserve
contains.definition: A code to indicate whether and for whom funds are to be reserved for future claims.

contains.name: related
contains.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.

contains.name: claim
contains.definition: Reference to a related claim.

contains.name: relationship
contains.definition: A code to convey how the claims are related.

contains.name: reference
contains.definition: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains.

contains.name: prescription
contains.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

contains.name: originalPrescription
contains.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.

contains.name: payee
contains.definition: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: subscriber, provider, other.

contains.name: party
contains.definition: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.

contains.name: referral
contains.definition: A reference to a referral resource.

contains.name: facility
contains.definition: Facility where the services were provided.

contains.name: careTeam
contains.definition: The members of the team who provided the products and services.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify care team entries.

contains.name: provider
contains.definition: Member of the team who provided the product or service.

contains.name: responsible
contains.definition: The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.

contains.name: role
contains.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.

contains.name: qualification
contains.definition: The qualification of the practitioner which is applicable for this service.

contains.name: supportingInfo
contains.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought.

contains.name: timingDate
contains.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

contains.name: timingPeriod
contains.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

contains.name: valueBoolean
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: valueString
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: valueQuantity
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: valueAttachment
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: valueReference
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: reason
contains.definition: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.

contains.name: diagnosis
contains.definition: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.

contains.name: diagnosisCodeableConcept
contains.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

contains.name: diagnosisReference
contains.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

contains.name: onAdmission
contains.definition: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.

contains.name: packageCode
contains.definition: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.

contains.name: procedure
contains.definition: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

contains.name: date
contains.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.

contains.name: procedureCodeableConcept
contains.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

contains.name: procedureReference
contains.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

contains.name: udi
contains.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

contains.name: insurance
contains.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify insurance entries and provide a sequence of coverages to convey coordination of benefit order.

contains.name: focal
contains.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: The business identifier to be used when the claim is sent for adjudication against this insurance policy.

contains.name: coverage
contains.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

contains.name: businessArrangement
contains.definition: A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.

contains.name: preAuthRef
contains.definition: Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.

contains.name: claimResponse
contains.definition: The result of the adjudication of the line items for the Coverage specified in this insurance.

contains.name: accident
contains.definition: Details of an accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.

contains.name: date
contains.definition: Date of an accident event  related to the products and services contained in the claim.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.

contains.name: locationAddress
contains.definition: The physical location of the accident event.

contains.name: locationReference
contains.definition: The physical location of the accident event.

contains.name: sequence

contains.name: careTeamSequence

contains.name: diagnosisSequence

contains.name: procedureSequence

contains.name: informationSequence

contains.name: revenue
contains.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.

contains.name: productOrService
contains.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.

contains.name: servicedDate

contains.name: locationAddress

contains.name: locationReference

contains.name: quantity

contains.name: unitPrice

contains.name: factor

contains.name: net

contains.name: bodySite

contains.name: encounter

Condition.definition: A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this condition by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

contains.name: clinicalStatus
contains.definition: The clinical status of the condition.

contains.name: verificationStatus
contains.definition: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: A category assigned to the condition.

contains.name: severity
contains.definition: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

contains.name: bodySite
contains.definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

contains.name: subject
contains.definition: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: The Encounter during which this Condition was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

contains.name: onsetDateTime
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

contains.name: onsetAge
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

contains.name: onsetPeriod
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

contains.name: onsetRange
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

contains.name: onsetString
contains.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

contains.name: abatementDateTime
contains.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

contains.name: abatementAge
contains.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

contains.name: abatementPeriod
contains.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

contains.name: abatementRange
contains.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

contains.name: abatementString
contains.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

contains.name: recordedDate
contains.definition: The recordedDate represents when this particular Condition record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

contains.name: recorder
contains.definition: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

contains.name: asserter
contains.definition: Individual who is making the condition statement.

contains.name: stage
contains.definition: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

contains.name: summary
contains.definition: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.

contains.name: assessment
contains.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The kind of staging, such as pathological or clinical staging.

contains.name: evidence
contains.definition: Supporting evidence / manifestations that are the basis of the Condition's verification status, such as evidence that confirmed or refuted the condition.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.

contains.name: detail
contains.definition: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

contains.name: note
contains.definition: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry  for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

Coverage.definition: Financial instrument which may be used to reimburse or pay for health care products and services. Includes both insurance and self-payment.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this coverage.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: The status of the resource instance.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The type of coverage: social program, medical plan, accident coverage (workers compensation, auto), group health or payment by an individual or organization.

contains.name: policyHolder
contains.definition: The party who 'owns' the insurance policy.

contains.name: subscriber
contains.definition: The party who has signed-up for or 'owns' the contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy for services rendered to them or their family is due.

contains.name: subscriberId
contains.definition: The insurer assigned ID for the Subscriber.

contains.name: beneficiary
contains.definition: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage; the patient when products and/or services are provided.

contains.name: dependent
contains.definition: A unique identifier for a dependent under the coverage.

contains.name: relationship
contains.definition: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) to the subscriber.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: Time period during which the coverage is in force. A missing start date indicates the start date isn't known, a missing end date means the coverage is continuing to be in force.

contains.name: payor
contains.definition: The program or plan underwriter or payor including both insurance and non-insurance agreements, such as patient-pay agreements.

contains.name: class
contains.definition: A suite of underwriter specific classifiers.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The type of classification for which an insurer-specific class label or number and optional name is provided, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, Policy, Plan.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: The alphanumeric string value associated with the insurer issued label.

contains.name: name
contains.definition: A short description for the class.

contains.name: order
contains.definition: The order of applicability of this coverage relative to other coverages which are currently in force. Note, there may be gaps in the numbering and this does not imply primary, secondary etc. as the specific positioning of coverages depends upon the episode of care.

contains.name: network
contains.definition: The insurer-specific identifier for the insurer-defined network of providers to which the beneficiary may seek treatment which will be covered at the 'in-network' rate, otherwise 'out of network' terms and conditions apply.

contains.name: costToBeneficiary
contains.definition: A suite of codes indicating the cost category and associated amount which have been detailed in the policy and may have been  included on the health card.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The category of patient centric costs associated with treatment.

contains.name: valueQuantity
contains.definition: The amount due from the patient for the cost category.

contains.name: valueMoney
contains.definition: The amount due from the patient for the cost category.

contains.name: exception
contains.definition: A suite of codes indicating exceptions or reductions to patient costs and their effective periods.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The code for the specific exception.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: The timeframe during when the exception is in force.

contains.name: subrogation
contains.definition: When 'subrogation=true' this insurance instance has been included not for adjudication but to provide insurers with the details to recover costs.

contains.name: contract
contains.definition: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.

DiagnosticReport.definition: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: Identifiers assigned to this report by the performer or other systems.

contains.name: basedOn
contains.definition: Details concerning a service requested.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: The status of the diagnostic report.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: A code that classifies the clinical discipline, department or diagnostic service that created the report (e.g. cardiology, biochemistry, hematology, MRI). This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: A code or name that describes this diagnostic report.

contains.name: subject
contains.definition: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However, diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport is about.

contains.name: effectiveDateTime
contains.definition: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

contains.name: effectivePeriod
contains.definition: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

contains.name: issued
contains.definition: The date and time that this version of the report was made available to providers, typically after the report was reviewed and verified.

contains.name: performer
contains.definition: The diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report.

contains.name: resultsInterpreter
contains.definition: The practitioner or organization that is responsible for the report's conclusions and interpretations.

contains.name: specimen
contains.definition: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.

contains.name: result
contains.definition: [Observations](observation.html)  that are part of this diagnostic report.

contains.name: imagingStudy
contains.definition: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.

contains.name: media
contains.definition: A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).

contains.name: comment
contains.definition: A comment about the image. Typically, this is used to provide an explanation for why the image is included, or to draw the viewer's attention to important features.

contains.name: link
contains.definition: Reference to the image source.

contains.name: conclusion
contains.definition: Concise and clinically contextualized summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.

contains.name: conclusionCode
contains.definition: One or more codes that represent the summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.

contains.name: presentedForm
contains.definition: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent.

Encounter.definition: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

contains.name: statusHistory
contains.definition: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: The time that the episode was in the specified status.

contains.name: class
contains.definition: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.

contains.name: classHistory
contains.definition: The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.  This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transitions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kind of discharge from emergency to inpatient.

contains.name: class
contains.definition: inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: The time that the episode was in the specified class.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

contains.name: serviceType
contains.definition: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided (e.g. cardiology).

contains.name: priority
contains.definition: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

contains.name: subject
contains.definition: The patient or group present at the encounter.

contains.name: episodeOfCare
contains.definition: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

contains.name: basedOn
contains.definition: The request this encounter satisfies (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

contains.name: participant
contains.definition: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Role of participant in encounter.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: The period of time that the specified participant participated in the encounter. These can overlap or be sub-sets of the overall encounter's period.

contains.name: individual
contains.definition: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient.

contains.name: appointment
contains.definition: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: The start and end time of the encounter.

contains.name: length
contains.definition: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.

contains.name: reasonCode
contains.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

contains.name: reasonReference
contains.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

contains.name: diagnosis
contains.definition: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

contains.name: condition
contains.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

contains.name: use
contains.definition: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge …).

contains.name: rank
contains.definition: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type).

contains.name: account
contains.definition: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

contains.name: hospitalization
contains.definition: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.

contains.name: preAdmissionIdentifier
contains.definition: Pre-admission identifier.

contains.name: origin
contains.definition: The location/organization from which the patient came before admission.

contains.name: admitSource
contains.definition: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer).

contains.name: reAdmission
contains.definition: Whether this hospitalization is a readmission and why if known.

contains.name: dietPreference
contains.definition: Diet preferences reported by the patient.

contains.name: specialCourtesy
contains.definition: Special courtesies (VIP, board member).

contains.name: specialArrangement
contains.definition: Any special requests that have been made for this hospitalization encounter, such as the provision of specific equipment or other things.

contains.name: destination
contains.definition: Location/organization to which the patient is discharged.

contains.name: dischargeDisposition
contains.definition: Category or kind of location after discharge.

contains.name: location
contains.definition: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.

contains.name: location
contains.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.

contains.name: physicalType
contains.definition: This will be used to specify the required levels (bed/ward/room/etc.) desired to be recorded to simplify either messaging or query.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

contains.name: serviceProvider
contains.definition: The organization that is primarily responsible for this Encounter's services. This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different, such as if the actor performing the services was from an external organization (which may be billed seperately) for an external consultation.  Refer to the example bundle showing an abbreviated set of Encounters for a colonoscopy.

contains.name: partOf
contains.definition: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this explanation of benefit.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: The status of the resource instance.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The category of claim, e.g. oral, pharmacy, vision, institutional, professional.

contains.name: subType
contains.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.

contains.name: use
contains.definition: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: to request adjudication of products and services previously rendered; or requesting authorization and adjudication for provision in the future; or requesting the non-binding adjudication of the listed products and services which could be provided in the future.

contains.name: patient
contains.definition: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual for forecast reimbursement is sought.

contains.name: billablePeriod
contains.definition: The period for which charges are being submitted.

contains.name: created
contains.definition: The date this resource was created.

contains.name: enterer
contains.definition: Individual who created the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

contains.name: insurer
contains.definition: The party responsible for authorization, adjudication and reimbursement.

contains.name: provider
contains.definition: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

contains.name: priority
contains.definition: The provider-required urgency of processing the request. Typical values include: stat, routine deferred.

contains.name: fundsReserveRequested
contains.definition: A code to indicate whether and for whom funds are to be reserved for future claims.

contains.name: fundsReserve
contains.definition: A code, used only on a response to a preauthorization, to indicate whether the benefits payable have been reserved and for whom.

contains.name: related
contains.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.

contains.name: claim
contains.definition: Reference to a related claim.

contains.name: relationship
contains.definition: A code to convey how the claims are related.

contains.name: reference
contains.definition: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains.

contains.name: prescription
contains.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

contains.name: originalPrescription
contains.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.

contains.name: payee
contains.definition: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

contains.name: party
contains.definition: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.

contains.name: referral
contains.definition: A reference to a referral resource.

contains.name: facility
contains.definition: Facility where the services were provided.

contains.name: claim
contains.definition: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication request: claim predetermination or preauthorization.

contains.name: claimResponse
contains.definition: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication response: claim, predetermination or preauthorization response.

contains.name: outcome
contains.definition: The outcome of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization processing.

contains.name: disposition
contains.definition: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.

contains.name: preAuthRef
contains.definition: Reference from the Insurer which is used in later communications which refers to this adjudication.

contains.name: preAuthRefPeriod
contains.definition: The timeframe during which the supplied preauthorization reference may be quoted on claims to obtain the adjudication as provided.

contains.name: careTeam
contains.definition: The members of the team who provided the products and services.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify care team entries.

contains.name: provider
contains.definition: Member of the team who provided the product or service.

contains.name: responsible
contains.definition: The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.

contains.name: role
contains.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.

contains.name: qualification
contains.definition: The qualification of the practitioner which is applicable for this service.

contains.name: supportingInfo
contains.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought.

contains.name: timingDate
contains.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

contains.name: timingPeriod
contains.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

contains.name: valueBoolean
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: valueString
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: valueQuantity
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: valueAttachment
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: valueReference
contains.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

contains.name: reason
contains.definition: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.

contains.name: diagnosis
contains.definition: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.

contains.name: diagnosisCodeableConcept
contains.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

contains.name: diagnosisReference
contains.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

contains.name: onAdmission
contains.definition: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.

contains.name: packageCode
contains.definition: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.

contains.name: procedure
contains.definition: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

contains.name: date
contains.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.

contains.name: procedureCodeableConcept
contains.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

contains.name: procedureReference
contains.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

contains.name: udi
contains.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

contains.name: precedence
contains.definition: This indicates the relative order of a series of EOBs related to different coverages for the same suite of services.

contains.name: insurance
contains.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.

contains.name: focal
contains.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.

contains.name: coverage
contains.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

contains.name: preAuthRef
contains.definition: Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.

contains.name: accident
contains.definition: Details of a accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.

contains.name: date
contains.definition: Date of an accident event  related to the products and services contained in the claim.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.

contains.name: locationAddress
contains.definition: The physical location of the accident event.

contains.name: locationReference
contains.definition: The physical location of the accident event.

contains.name: item
contains.definition: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

contains.name: sequence
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify item entries.

contains.name: careTeamSequence
contains.definition: Care team members related to this service or product.

contains.name: diagnosisSequence
contains.definition: Diagnoses applicable for this service or product.

contains.name: procedureSequence
contains.definition: Procedures applicable for this service or product.

contains.name: informationSequence
contains.definition: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product.

contains.name: revenue
contains.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.

contains.name: productOrService
contains.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.

contains.name: modifier
contains.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.

contains.name: programCode
contains.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.

contains.name: servicedDate
contains.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

contains.name: servicedPeriod
contains.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

contains.name: locationCodeableConcept
contains.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

contains.name: locationAddress
contains.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

contains.name: locationReference
contains.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

contains.name: quantity
contains.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

contains.name: unitPrice
contains.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

contains.name: factor
contains.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

contains.name: net
contains.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.

contains.name: udi
contains.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

contains.name: bodySite
contains.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).

contains.name: subSite
contains.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

contains.name: noteNumber
contains.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

contains.name: adjudication
contains.definition: If this item is a group then the values here are a summary of the adjudication of the detail items. If this item is a simple product or service then this is the result of the adjudication of this item.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in-aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.

contains.name: reason
contains.definition: A code supporting the understanding of the adjudication result and explaining variance from expected amount.

contains.name: amount
contains.definition: Monetary amount associated with the category.

contains.name: value
contains.definition: A non-monetary value associated with the category. Mutually exclusive to the amount element above.

contains.name: detail
contains.definition: Second-tier of goods and services.

contains.name: sequence
