contains.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

contains.name: factor
contains.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

contains.name: net
contains.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.

contains.name: noteNumber
contains.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

contains.name: adjudication
contains.definition: The adjudication results.

contains.name: subDetail
contains.definition: The third-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

contains.name: productOrService
contains.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.

contains.name: modifier
contains.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.

contains.name: quantity
contains.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

contains.name: unitPrice
contains.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

contains.name: factor
contains.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

contains.name: net
contains.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.

contains.name: noteNumber
contains.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

contains.name: adjudication
contains.definition: The adjudication results.

contains.name: adjudication
contains.definition: The adjudication results which are presented at the header level rather than at the line-item or add-item levels.

contains.name: total
contains.definition: Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.

contains.name: amount
contains.definition: Monetary total amount associated with the category.

contains.name: payment
contains.definition: Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the benefits payable.

contains.name: adjustment
contains.definition: Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.

contains.name: adjustmentReason
contains.definition: Reason for the payment adjustment.

contains.name: date
contains.definition: Estimated date the payment will be issued or the actual issue date of payment.

contains.name: amount
contains.definition: Benefits payable less any payment adjustment.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.

contains.name: formCode
contains.definition: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.

contains.name: form
contains.definition: The actual form, by reference or inclusion, for printing the content or an EOB.

contains.name: processNote
contains.definition: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.

contains.name: number
contains.definition: A number to uniquely identify a note entry.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The business purpose of the note text.

contains.name: text
contains.definition: The explanation or description associated with the processing.

contains.name: language
contains.definition: A code to define the language used in the text of the note.

contains.name: benefitPeriod
contains.definition: The term of the benefits documented in this response.

contains.name: benefitBalance
contains.definition: Balance by Benefit Category.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.

contains.name: excluded
contains.definition: True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicates the product or service is included in the coverage.

contains.name: name
contains.definition: A short name or tag for the benefit.

contains.name: description
contains.definition: A richer description of the benefit or services covered.

contains.name: network
contains.definition: Is a flag to indicate whether the benefits refer to in-network providers or out-of-network providers.

contains.name: unit
contains.definition: Indicates if the benefits apply to an individual or to the family.

contains.name: term
contains.definition: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual visits'.

contains.name: financial
contains.definition: Benefits Used to date.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Classification of benefit being provided.

contains.name: allowedUnsignedInt
contains.definition: The quantity of the benefit which is permitted under the coverage.

contains.name: allowedString
contains.definition: The quantity of the benefit which is permitted under the coverage.

contains.name: allowedMoney
contains.definition: The quantity of the benefit which is permitted under the coverage.

contains.name: usedUnsignedInt
contains.definition: The quantity of the benefit which have been consumed to date.

contains.name: usedMoney
contains.definition: The quantity of the benefit which have been consumed to date.

ImagingStudy.definition: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: Identifiers for the ImagingStudy such as DICOM Study Instance UID, and Accession Number.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: The current state of the ImagingStudy.

contains.name: modality
contains.definition: A list of all the series.modality values that are actual acquisition modalities, i.e. those in the DICOM Context Group 29 (value set OID 1.2.840.10008.6.1.19).

contains.name: subject
contains.definition: The subject, typically a patient, of the imaging study.

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this ImagingStudy is made.

contains.name: started
contains.definition: Date and time the study started.

contains.name: basedOn
contains.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

contains.name: referrer
contains.definition: The requesting/referring physician.

contains.name: interpreter
contains.definition: Who read the study and interpreted the images or other content.

contains.name: endpoint
contains.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.connectionType.

contains.name: numberOfSeries
contains.definition: Number of Series in the Study. This value given may be larger than the number of series elements this Resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any series elements are present.

contains.name: numberOfInstances
contains.definition: Number of SOP Instances in Study. This value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.

contains.name: procedureReference
contains.definition: The procedure which this ImagingStudy was part of.

contains.name: procedureCode
contains.definition: The code for the performed procedure type.

contains.name: location
contains.definition: The principal physical location where the ImagingStudy was performed.

contains.name: reasonCode
contains.definition: Description of clinical condition indicating why the ImagingStudy was requested.

contains.name: reasonReference
contains.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this Study.

contains.name: note
contains.definition: Per the recommended DICOM mapping, this element is derived from the Study Description attribute (0008,1030). Observations or findings about the imaging study should be recorded in another resource, e.g. Observation, and not in this element.

contains.name: description
contains.definition: The Imaging Manager description of the study. Institution-generated description or classification of the Study (component) performed.

contains.name: series
contains.definition: Each study has one or more series of images or other content.

contains.name: uid
contains.definition: The DICOM Series Instance UID for the series.

contains.name: number
contains.definition: The numeric identifier of this series in the study.

contains.name: modality
contains.definition: The modality of this series sequence.

contains.name: description
contains.definition: A description of the series.

contains.name: numberOfInstances
contains.definition: Number of SOP Instances in the Study. The value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.

contains.name: endpoint
contains.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for this series. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A series-level endpoint, if present, has precedence over a study-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.connectionType.

contains.name: bodySite
contains.definition: The anatomic structures examined. See DICOM Part 16 Annex L (http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings. The bodySite may indicate the laterality of body part imaged; if so, it shall be consistent with any content of ImagingStudy.series.laterality.

contains.name: laterality
contains.definition: The laterality of the (possibly paired) anatomic structures examined. E.g., the left knee, both lungs, or unpaired abdomen. If present, shall be consistent with any laterality information indicated in ImagingStudy.series.bodySite.

contains.name: specimen
contains.definition: The specimen imaged, e.g., for whole slide imaging of a biopsy.

contains.name: started
contains.definition: The date and time the series was started.

contains.name: performer
contains.definition: Indicates who or what performed the series and how they were involved.

contains.name: function
contains.definition: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the series.

contains.name: actor
contains.definition: Indicates who or what performed the series.

contains.name: instance
contains.definition: A single SOP instance within the series, e.g. an image, or presentation state.

contains.name: uid
contains.definition: The DICOM SOP Instance UID for this image or other DICOM content.

contains.name: sopClass
contains.definition: DICOM instance  type.

contains.name: number
contains.definition: The number of instance in the series.

contains.name: title
contains.definition: The description of the instance.

Immunization.definition: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccine or a record of an immunization as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: Indicates the current status of the immunization event.

contains.name: statusReason
contains.definition: Indicates the reason the immunization event was not performed.

contains.name: vaccineCode
contains.definition: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

contains.name: patient
contains.definition: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

contains.name: occurrenceDateTime
contains.definition: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.

contains.name: occurrenceString
contains.definition: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.

contains.name: recorded
contains.definition: The date the occurrence of the immunization was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

contains.name: primarySource
contains.definition: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.

contains.name: reportOrigin
contains.definition: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.

contains.name: location
contains.definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

contains.name: manufacturer
contains.definition: Name of vaccine manufacturer.

contains.name: lotNumber
contains.definition: Lot number of the  vaccine product.

contains.name: expirationDate
contains.definition: Date vaccine batch expires.

contains.name: site
contains.definition: Body site where vaccine was administered.

contains.name: route
contains.definition: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

contains.name: doseQuantity
contains.definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

contains.name: performer
contains.definition: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

contains.name: function
contains.definition: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

contains.name: actor
contains.definition: The practitioner or organization who performed the action.

contains.name: note
contains.definition: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

contains.name: reasonCode
contains.definition: Reasons why the vaccine was administered.

contains.name: reasonReference
contains.definition: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

contains.name: isSubpotent
contains.definition: Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.

contains.name: subpotentReason
contains.definition: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

contains.name: education
contains.definition: Educational material presented to the patient (or guardian) at the time of vaccine administration.

contains.name: documentType
contains.definition: Identifier of the material presented to the patient.

contains.name: reference
contains.definition: Reference pointer to the educational material given to the patient if the information was on line.

contains.name: publicationDate
contains.definition: Date the educational material was published.

contains.name: presentationDate
contains.definition: Date the educational material was given to the patient.

contains.name: programEligibility
contains.definition: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

contains.name: fundingSource
contains.definition: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).

contains.name: reaction
contains.definition: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

contains.name: date
contains.definition: Date of reaction to the immunization.

contains.name: detail
contains.definition: Details of the reaction.

contains.name: reported
contains.definition: Self-reported indicator.

contains.name: protocolApplied
contains.definition: The protocol (set of recommendations) being followed by the provider who administered the dose.

contains.name: series
contains.definition: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

contains.name: authority
contains.definition: Indicates the authority who published the protocol (e.g. ACIP) that is being followed.

contains.name: targetDisease
contains.definition: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being administered against.

contains.name: doseNumberPositiveInt
contains.definition: Nominal position in a series.

contains.name: doseNumberString
contains.definition: Nominal position in a series.

contains.name: seriesDosesPositiveInt
contains.definition: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.

contains.name: seriesDosesString
contains.definition: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.

MedicationRequest.definition: An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: Identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: A code specifying the current state of the order.  Generally, this will be active or completed state.

contains.name: statusReason
contains.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.

contains.name: intent
contains.definition: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).

contains.name: priority
contains.definition: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

contains.name: doNotPerform
contains.definition: If true indicates that the provider is asking for the medication request not to occur.

contains.name: reportedBoolean
contains.definition: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record.  It may also indicate the source of the report.

contains.name: reportedReference
contains.definition: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record.  It may also indicate the source of the report.

contains.name: medicationCodeableConcept
contains.definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

contains.name: medicationReference
contains.definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

contains.name: subject
contains.definition: A link to a resource representing the person or set of individuals to whom the medication will be given.

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: The Encounter during which this [x] was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

contains.name: supportingInformation
contains.definition: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

contains.name: authoredOn
contains.definition: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

contains.name: requester
contains.definition: The individual, organization, or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

contains.name: performer
contains.definition: The specified desired performer of the medication treatment (e.g. the performer of the medication administration).

contains.name: performerType
contains.definition: Indicates the type of performer of the administration of the medication.

contains.name: recorder
contains.definition: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

contains.name: reasonCode
contains.definition: The reason or the indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.

contains.name: reasonReference
contains.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

contains.name: instantiatesCanonical
contains.definition: The URL pointing to a protocol, guideline, orderset, or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

contains.name: instantiatesUri
contains.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

contains.name: basedOn
contains.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

contains.name: groupIdentifier
contains.definition: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition or prescription.

contains.name: courseOfTherapyType
contains.definition: The description of the overall patte3rn of the administration of the medication to the patient.

contains.name: insurance
contains.definition: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

contains.name: note
contains.definition: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

contains.name: dosageInstruction
contains.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

contains.name: dispenseRequest
contains.definition: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order).  Note that this information is not always sent with the order.  There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

contains.name: initialFill
contains.definition: Indicates the quantity or duration for the first dispense of the medication.

contains.name: quantity
contains.definition: The amount or quantity to provide as part of the first dispense.

contains.name: duration
contains.definition: The length of time that the first dispense is expected to last.

contains.name: dispenseInterval
contains.definition: The minimum period of time that must occur between dispenses of the medication.

contains.name: validityPeriod
contains.definition: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).

contains.name: numberOfRepeatsAllowed
contains.definition: An integer indicating the number of times, in addition to the original dispense, (aka refills or repeats) that the patient can receive the prescribed medication. Usage Notes: This integer does not include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus "3 repeats", then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets.  A prescriber may explicitly say that zero refills are permitted after the initial dispense.

contains.name: quantity
contains.definition: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

contains.name: expectedSupplyDuration
contains.definition: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.

contains.name: performer
contains.definition: Indicates the intended dispensing Organization specified by the prescriber.

contains.name: substitution
contains.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

contains.name: allowedBoolean
contains.definition: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

contains.name: allowedCodeableConcept
contains.definition: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

contains.name: reason
contains.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.

contains.name: priorPrescription
contains.definition: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

contains.name: detectedIssue
contains.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

contains.name: eventHistory
contains.definition: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.

Observation.definition: Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

contains.name: basedOn
contains.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.  For example, a MedicationRequest may require a patient to have laboratory test performed before  it is dispensed.

contains.name: partOf
contains.definition: A larger event of which this particular Observation is a component or step.  For example,  an observation as part of a procedure.

contains.name: status
contains.definition: The status of the result value.

contains.name: category
contains.definition: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

contains.name: subject
contains.definition: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device this observation is about and into whose record the observation is placed. If the actual focus of the observation is different from the subject (or a sample of, part, or region of the subject), the `focus` element or the `code` itself specifies the actual focus of the observation.

contains.name: focus
contains.definition: The actual focus of an observation when it is not the patient of record representing something or someone associated with the patient such as a spouse, parent, fetus, or donor. For example, fetus observations in a mother's record.  The focus of an observation could also be an existing condition,  an intervention, the subject's diet,  another observation of the subject,  or a body structure such as tumor or implanted device.   An example use case would be using the Observation resource to capture whether the mother is trained to change her child's tracheostomy tube. In this example, the child is the patient of record and the mother is the focus.

contains.name: encounter
contains.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

contains.name: effectiveDateTime
contains.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

contains.name: effectivePeriod
contains.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

contains.name: effectiveTiming
contains.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

contains.name: effectiveInstant
contains.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

contains.name: issued
contains.definition: The date and time this version of the observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

contains.name: performer
contains.definition: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

contains.name: valueQuantity
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueCodeableConcept
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueString
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueBoolean
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueInteger
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueRange
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueRatio
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueSampledData
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueTime
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valueDateTime
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: valuePeriod
contains.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

contains.name: dataAbsentReason
contains.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

contains.name: interpretation
contains.definition: A categorical assessment of an observation value.  For example, high, low, normal.

contains.name: note
contains.definition: Comments about the observation or the results.

contains.name: bodySite
contains.definition: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

contains.name: method
contains.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

contains.name: specimen
contains.definition: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

contains.name: device
contains.definition: The device used to generate the observation data.

contains.name: referenceRange
contains.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.  Multiple reference ranges are interpreted as an "OR".   In other words, to represent two distinct target populations, two `referenceRange` elements would be used.

contains.name: low
contains.definition: The value of the low bound of the reference range.  The low bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9). If the low bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is <=2.3).

contains.name: high
contains.definition: The value of the high bound of the reference range.  The high bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9). If the high bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is >= 2.3).

contains.name: type
contains.definition: Codes to indicate the what part of the targeted reference population it applies to. For example, the normal or therapeutic range.

contains.name: appliesTo
contains.definition: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to.  For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race.  Multiple `appliesTo`  are interpreted as an "AND" of the target populations.  For example, to represent a target population of African American females, both a code of female and a code for African American would be used.

contains.name: age
contains.definition: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.

contains.name: text
contains.definition: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation.  An example would be a reference value of "Negative" or a list or table of "normals".

contains.name: hasMember
contains.definition: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.

contains.name: derivedFrom
contains.definition: The target resource that represents a measurement from which this observation value is derived. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.

contains.name: component
contains.definition: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

contains.name: code
contains.definition: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "code".

contains.name: dataAbsentReason
contains.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.component.value[x] is missing.

contains.name: interpretation
contains.definition: A categorical assessment of an observation value.  For example, high, low, normal.

contains.name: referenceRange
contains.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.

Patient.definition: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

contains.name: identifier
contains.definition: An identifier for this patient.

contains.name: active
contains.definition:
Whether this patient record is in active use. 
Many systems use this property to mark as non-current patients, such as those that have not been seen for a period of time based on an organization's business rules.

It is often used to filter patient lists to exclude inactive patients

Deceased patients may also be marked as inactive for the same reasons, but may be active for some time after death.

contains.name: name
contains.definition: A name associated with the individual.

contains.name: telecom
contains.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the individual may be contacted.

contains.name: gender
contains.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

contains.name: birthDate
contains.definition: The date of birth for the individual.

contains.name: deceasedBoolean
contains.definition: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.

contains.name: deceasedDateTime
contains.definition: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.

contains.name: address
contains.definition: An address for the individual.

contains.name: maritalStatus
contains.definition: This field contains a patient's most recent marital (civil) status.

contains.name: multipleBirthBoolean
contains.definition: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple (boolean) or indicates the actual birth order (integer).

contains.name: multipleBirthInteger
contains.definition: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple (boolean) or indicates the actual birth order (integer).

contains.name: photo
contains.definition: Image of the patient.

contains.name: contact
contains.definition: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient.

contains.name: relationship
contains.definition: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the contact person.

contains.name: name
contains.definition: A name associated with the contact person.

contains.name: telecom
contains.definition: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.

contains.name: address
contains.definition: Address for the contact person.

contains.name: gender
contains.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the contact person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

contains.name: organization
contains.definition: Organization on behalf of which the contact is acting or for which the contact is working.

contains.name: period
contains.definition: The period during which this contact person or organization is valid to be contacted relating to this patient.

contains.name: communication
contains.definition: A language which may be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.

contains.name: language
contains.definition: The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case; e.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-EN" for England English.

contains.name: preferred
contains.definition: Indicates whether or not the patient prefers this language (over other languages he masters up a certain level).

contains.name: generalPractitioner
contains.definition: Patient's nominated care provider.

contains.name: managingOrganization
contains.definition: Organization that is the custodian of the patient record.

contains.name: link
contains.definition: Link to another patient resource that concerns the same actual patient.

contains.name: other
contains.definition: The other patient resource that the link refers to.

contains.name: type
contains.definition: The type of link between this patient resource and another patient resource.
